text: Practice Problem 5.1 (solution page 609) The following problem illustrates the way memory aliasing can cause unexpected program behavior. Consider the following procedure to swap two values: 1 /+ Swap value x at xp with value y at yp +/ 2 void swap(long *xp, long *yp) 3 o 4 XP = *Xp + *yp; /¥ xty */ 5 *yp = *Xp — *yp; /* xty-y = x */ 6 *Xp = *Xp — *yp; /* xty-x = y */ 7 ) If this procedure is called with xp equal to yp, what effect will it have?
